content: Hi everyone.  I was taking gabapentin for the nerve damage pain for the last 9 months and finally STOPPED taking it. It did not help much but I would end up vomiting every few weeks.   I also was put on doxycycline antibiotics for an ulcer on my toe that I have. It’s taking forever to heal. Been going to Podiatrist. The doxycycline is ALSO making my stomach ache so bad and making me gag and vomit.  STOPPED THE DOXYCYCLINE NOW after telling Doc.  How can I make my stomach feel better??   The neuropathy hurts so bad in my legs but it’s my stomach that’s worse.  I did however get an ultrasound for my cold legs today and heard my heartbeat while it was being done. Hope that’s a good sign.  I’m so lost here.  I have been on metformin and a BP med amlodipine since diagnosis a year ago.  Any thoughts other than warm mint tea, tagament and chewable pepto for vomiting? I want to go into my hot tub so badly for neuropathy but Podiatrist says no because toe ulcer is not completely healed. Thank you so much for any help.

content: UPDATE: just left neurologist... he increased gabapentin and prescribed carbamazepine.. anyone take this?  He referred me to a pain clinic.  There is a weird bump on my arm that has starting getting bigger and painful.. dr is concerned it could be cancerous I'm having a biopsy in August. I have to see diabetic dr.  Thank you all for your suggestions and support! God bless! PLEASE HELP!! I recently recovered from Covid, I was hospitalized..I got it pretty bad. Prior to covid I could manage my day to day life with neuropathy...... fast forward to today...my only wish is for God to call me home. I can't take it anymore... the pain is so intense... the burning and numbness I can't handle it. My fingers recently started curling and I have zero control of my hand when this happens.  Im feeling a pain ive NEVER EVER FELT BEFORE!!! my neurologist is taking me in tomorrow morning on a urgent visit.  I'm maxed out on gabapentin.. isn't working at all...lyrica.. not a thing...oxytocin nothing..tylenol 3 nothing..trazadone nothing... none of these meds are working. I need to ask my neurologist for something to tranquilize me or something to help... what do you guys recommend me asking for?  Thank you for reading this and any advice is much appreciated!!

content: Hello All,  This is my first post here.  I am a diabetic, “considered as uncontrolled” by MD.  I was diagnosed in 2014, after my A1C labs came back at 8.8.  However, since I worked for Kaiser Permanente at the time, I decided to do some research on my own regarding my ailment; I read up about all of the side effects for most of the diabetes medications, hmmm.., I refused any kind of medication......I flat out told my MD not “Fn” happening. I told her I would take control of my diabetes through diet and exercise.  So I did, and within 90 days I went back to get an A1C recheck, my digits had dropped to 6.0 a significant drop.  My MD did not try to push any kind of meds on me again, she knew I was very serious about taking control and getting better.  However she was adamant that I check my BS daily and keep it within the 120 range.   So I was now on my new journey and that was for me to take care of me the best I could. Also, I truly did not plan for it, but as a side effect, I dropped 90lbs.  That definitely was not in my plans. I was not even trying to loose weight, it just happened, I had topped out at 340lbs, and started loosing what a great incentive.  I had maintained 250lbs for quite sometime, but just couldn’t seem to shed anymore with what I was doing.  Of course I had never heard of IF or Keto until May of this year.  It was my son who introduced me to this way of eating.   He told me that I was basically already eating the Keto way but I should incorporate an IF plan as well.  After more research on IF and Keto, I found it to be an easy crossover for me.  I jumped right in and started immediately with an 18:6 routine, with a 44 hr Fast on the weekends.  With more research, I also found out that some of the veggies I had not given up along with a lot of fruit were detrimental to me and what I was trying to do, “live longer”.  I then understood why my weight had stalled back then.  At that time I wasn’t aware of all the other options I had available to me.   So now it’s  2018 and time to retire, so what do I do, of course I managed to pack on 38lbs....I stopped my exercise, and walking, I got lazy.  So when I stepped onto the scale and looked down at the numbers, I was not very happy with myself.  I knew then that something had to change again for me because I refused to take Metformin or Insulin injections.   I am happy to say that since 5/25 of starting my new life style I have shed 20lbs of those 38lbs.    I am on a roll now, and I know now that I will make my goal of 155lbs.  I’ve been shedding 2lbs consistently since my 5/25 start; and my BS has become more stable, between 108 to 135 depending on before meals or after meals.   So I am tickled to have found another group to relate to and tell my story too and be someone else’s support if needed. That’s my story and I’m sticking to it.
